name: get_installed_apps
description: Retrieves the list of applications installed on the device. The returned list consists of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains the application name under a "name" field.

name: open_app
description: Opens the requested application on the device. If an exact match for "alarms" or "timers" is unavailable, it attempts to open any clock app as a less-preferred fallback.

app_name.description: The name of the application to open. This name must exactly match one of the names returned by `get_installed_apps`.

app_package_name.description: An optional string that specifies the package name of the application to open.

extras.description: A JSON string containing additional data to send to the opened application. This parameter is exclusively used when opening "Pixel Screenshots". When used, it must contain a "query" key whose value is the information-seeking part of the user prompt, which should ideally be a full question or sentence.

name: open_camera
description: Opens the device's camera. Specify whether to use the 'FRONT', 'REAR', or 'DEFAULT' camera, and set the initial functional mode to either 'PHOTO' or 'VIDEO'.

camera_type.description: Specifies the type of camera to open. This parameter must be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR', or 'DEFAULT'.

camera_operation.description: Specifies the initial functional mode for the camera upon opening. This parameter must be set to either 'PHOTO' or 'VIDEO'.

camera_mode.description: This parameter is deprecated and retained for binary compatibility.

name: open_home_screen
description: Navigate to the home screen on the device.

name: open_url
description: Opens the requested URL in a browser. Use this function only if the user prompt contains a URL or explicitly asks to open a website. When providing the URL, do not include the protocol (e.g., `https://`) if the user prompt does not include it.

url.description: The URL to open. Do not include the protocol (e.g., `https://`) if it is absent from the user's original prompt.

website_name.description: Specifies the name of the website to open. This parameter must not include the top-level domain.

name: open_websearch
description: Opens a Google search page with the provided query in the default web browser.

query.description: The text string representing the search query. This parameter specifies the content that will be used to open a Google search page in the user's default browser.

name: power_off_device
description: Intended to power off the device, this function only opens the power options menu.

name: record_video
description: Records a video using the device camera. Any requested recording delay will be ignored, and the recording will begin immediately.

camera_type.description: Specifies the type of camera to use for recording. It must be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR', or 'DEFAULT'.

self_timer_delay.description: This parameter is deprecated. It is retained solely for binary compatibility.

video_duration.description: Specifies the duration for the video recording. This parameter expects a string in the format of a request, such as "record a 15 second video".

name: restart_device
description: Opens the power options menu; this is the function's sole action to facilitate device restart.

name: ring_phone
description: Sends an action to the device to remotely ring the user's paired phone.

name: take_photo
description: Takes a photo using the device camera. Configure the camera type as 'FRONT' (for selfies), 'REAR', or 'DEFAULT'. You can also set a `self_timer_delay` (defaults to 3 seconds) or specify the camera mode as 'DEFAULT' or 'PORTRAIT'.

camera_type.description: Specifies the type of camera to open. This parameter accepts one of three string values: 'FRONT', 'REAR', or 'DEFAULT'. When a selfie is requested, the value 'FRONT' should be used.

self_timer_delay.description: Specifies the delay time before taking a photo. If this parameter is not provided, it defaults to '3 seconds'.

camera_mode.description: Defines the mode the camera should use for capturing a picture. Valid options are 'DEFAULT' or 'PORTRAIT'.

name: take_screenshot
description: Takes a screenshot on the device, returning a dictionary that details the action's result.
